p: Coccinia grandis (family Cucurbitaceae) is a unique tropical plant, commonly known as ‘little gourd’, growing abundantly and widely all over the India. It is a fast growing perennial climbing shrub with white flowers. It grows several meters long and forms dense mat that readily cover shrubs and small trees. It is well known for its hypoglycemic activity ( Ajay 2009, Munasinghe et al. 2011).
